``` Speaker A Input:
Speaker A: Are you planning on continuing to work in the lab when they clone the cow? That's really exciting!

Speaker A: Awww, don't quit if classes get too hard.  You seem like a really intelligent person. Honestly, I wouldn't knowingly eat a hamburger from a cloned cow, but I'm sure at some point we won't know the real source of where our beef is coming from.
Speaker B: Thanks for the encouragement! You wouldn't eat a cloned one, but would you try a Beyond burger or plant-based version? Some people say they taste really similar, but I never thought they tasted the same.
Speaker A: I think I would try a plant based burger.  I don't find anything wrong with plants, and it's worth trying for the experience alone.  I'm jut not familiar with the cloning process. Speaker B: That's good that you keep an open mind! The cloning process is actually relatively simple, and happens in nature already! Did you know bananas, avocados, and some bees clone themselves? The only difference is, we do this in a lab!
Speaker A: Oh! I did not know that. Well if you can clone cows that's more ice cream for you! Haha. What's your favorite ice cream flavor?
Speaker B: Yes, more ice cream is always good, haha! I like a good rocky road, or pretty much any chocolate ice cream with nuts or stir-ins! I like most of Jeni's brand too. How about you? What is your favorite kind?
``` 

``` Speaker A Input:
current_dialogue:
Speaker A: I loaded up on repellent like you said and I also grabbed a few of those mosquito repellent bracelets, I figured why not!
Speaker B: Have you been hiking lately?
Speaker A: Yes I did actually. I lead some friends on a hike in a local trail last weekend. They got tired really quickly as they never go hiking they told me.
Speaker B: Sounds like me. I am not a fan of the outdoors. Did your friends manage to have a good time anyway?
Speaker A: Oh they did. We had some nice snacks along the way. Oddly enough, we had some trail mix that someone had made at home. It was quite tasty. We also had some juice and water packed to make sure everyone stayed hydrated. You should join us one day! I'll make it as fun as possible.
Speaker B: I will someday. just not in the summer when all the bugs are out! Where do you go hiking the most?
Speaker A: I like to go hiking in the local trails here. I am familiar with them and there's so many routes that I can take. Sadly, the bugs are as bad here as they are anywhere else.....
Speaker B: They can't be that bad in the fall right? I hope? Do you camp most every weekend?
Speaker A: A least a couple of times a month. Sometimes, yeah, I go every weekend to relax. Being in nature is so relaxing to me. And nah the bugs aren't too bad in the fall and winter. There's a beautiful river along one trail that I bet you'd love to see. 
Speaker B: That sounds like it would be relaxing. I would probable be okay if we didn't run into any wolves, bears etc. Have you ever came across any predators when you were camping?
Speaker A: Oh I've seen bears and even a mountain lion. Luckily, it was a far away encounter and they didn't know that we were there. As soon as I saw them we changed directions fairly quickly but quietly. Don't worry, I've only seen it a handful of times in my time camping.
``` 

``` Speaker A Input:
Speaker A: Have you thought about taking a chance and doing something creative and more fulfilling full time? Either making movies or interior design, or is their another creative outlet that appeals to you?
Speaker B: I have been working producing horror movies and I really like it!  It is a lot more enjoyable than my day job.  Not sure that interior design is a good fit.  I just am good at painting houses.
Speaker A: The process of making horror movies must be fascinating.  Do you have any interesting stories from the set?
Speaker B: Oh yeah.  One time a makeup artist was applying fake blood all over a scene.  They had this all over their hands.  While they were spreading this blood around they cut a finger pretty bad.  They had no idea they had done this until they went to clean up.
Speaker A: That sounds gross.  By the way, what is movie blood made out of anyway?  Do you know or do you have a favorite blood recipe?
Speaker B: There is some weird chemical mix that I really do not mess with.  It is easy to clean up.  I try to stay away from this part of the movies.  I know what it should look like and that we want to keep everyone safe when using the fake blood.
Speaker A: Chemicals!  Do the actors hate working with it then?  I can imagine they are a pretty high maintenance bunch.  Do they worry about the blood messing with their looks?
Speaker B: Our actors are pretty amateur.  No big name ones so they are really good to work with.  Hey, how about you?  How is your interview practice going?  I am pretty sure you be excellent during it!
Speaker A: I think this discussion is helping me with making small talk, so thanks.  I just have to try and remember who i am and try to sell my good points.
``` 

``` Speaker B Input:
Speaker A: I found a lot of beginner recipes online for you to try. If your husband likes Asian food I found a few recipes you may want to try. Most pressure cookers also make rice.

Speaker B: Does it have eggs in it? We grow our own eggs so that might be the perfect starting point.
Speaker A: Yes, it contains eggs.  I think you would do well with the fried rice. It's best to cook the rice the day before.  
Speaker B: I didn't know that. Why cook the rice beforehand? Is it better to age rice or something?
Speaker A: The rice needs to be cool before adding to the pan.  Are you able to take a passenger along in you truck?
Speaker B: Oh! That makes since. I didn't realize that the temperature made a difference when frying rice. As for the truck, Yes I can. But, depending on what company I'm working for at the time, they often set restrictions on passengers.
Speaker A: The rice tends to stick together if it's warm.  I would like to ride along with you sometime when you're able.
Speaker B: I actually have a scheduled haul for next Wednesday. Do you want to come along for that ride? It should take about five hours.
``` 

``` Speaker B Input:
Related Evidences: (1) {'Related Topics': 'Lotto Tickets and Winning Strategy', 'Related Summaries': 'Speaker A and Speaker B talk about buying lotto tickets and share different strategies for increasing chances of winning.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Speaker A: I see that the lotto is big this week. Have you bought a ticket yet? This could be your chance. ### Speaker B: Yes, I bought 20 tickets when I saw how big the jackpot had gotten.  I don't think it's possible that I lose! ### Speaker A: Nice! I bought some too. 50 to be exact! My family thinks it's dumb of me to buy so many lol but hey it's worth a shot. ### Speaker B: You can't win if you don't play.  I know that for sure.  Hey, I had a really crazy idea and wanted to hear what you thought about it. ### Speaker A: Exactly! Yeah for sure, what's the crazy idea?? I'm very intrigued. ### Speaker B: So you know how when a jackpot is won by multiple people, they split it evenly with each winner?  So if the prize is $100 million and four people get the winning numbers, each person gets 25% of the jackpot?  Well think about this.  If I bought 20 tickets, all with the same numbers, and won the jackpot with three other people, instead of getting 25% of the jackpot, I'd get 20/23rds of the jackpot instead!  So that's what I did! ### Speaker A: LOL but now you only have one chance of winning! I did different numbers for all of my 50 tickets so I have 50 chances. ### Speaker B: Yeah, both strategies have their pros and cons.  But if I win I want it to be on the news.  They'll say, "There were 23 winners of the jackpot."  And then people will think, "Well that's lame.  Each person takes home such a tiny amount."  But then they'll say, "One insanely brilliant person had 20 winning tickets and is therefore getting the bulk of the jackpot."' }
```

How are you? ### Speaker B: I am good, how about you? ### Speaker A: Doing good. I invent things what do you do? ### Speaker B: I'm a workaholic. Do you like music? I like listening to black sabbath. ### Speaker A: I am more into science than music. ### Speaker B: That's interesting. What about your hobbies? ### Speaker A: Mainly I just invent things I like to teleport myself around the world.. ### Speaker B: Cool. I like grilling, because I like eating meat. ### Speaker A: My current project is a time machine. Have you ever traveled in time? ### Speaker B: I haven't. Mainly I just think about how much I have at work. ### Speaker A: What type of work do you do?' }(2) {'Related Topics': 'Cooking and Food Preferences', 'Related Summaries': 'Speaker A and Speaker B share their food preferences and discuss potential collaborations in cooking.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Speaker A: I prefer mexican food and seafood. Chicken enchiladas, tacos, shrimp shish kabob... Any baked fish. I like it all. If you are going to grill, maybe grilled corn and stuffed burgers ### Speaker B: Ugh that sounds like a plan. Maybe we can teleport around the world and I'll cook different types of cuisines?  ### Speaker A: Oh that would be the best thing ever! I love trying new food! Cooking is a science ya know! ### Speaker B: Ain't that the truth! Do you have any puppies by the way? ### Speaker A: I used to foster puppies, but I am too busy now to deal with them all the time. I do however visit shelters in every city I go to! ### Speaker B: Oh how cool. Are you an animal person? ### Speaker A: Of course! Puppies are my favorite, but dogs are cool too. It is nice to get to meet as many as possible while jumping from place to place. Maybe when I can move through space and time, I can go meet all the puppies from history!! ### Speaker B: But what about the kittens??? ### Speaker A: Have you had any time off for grilling? ### Speaker B: not really yet. I'm hoping I can grill this weekend though.  ### Speaker A: Do you have anything yummy planned out? It's raining here so I may do some indoor grilled veggies for fajitas. :) ### Speaker B: maybe some steaks. need to figure out a good side to go with it. ### Speaker A: Do you like grilled asparagus? I put a little lemon on mine and it's delicious.  ### Speaker B: I've never had it but definitely something to consider.  ### Speaker A: Usually people either really love it or hate it. Have you considered getting a job as a line cook?' }

``` Speaker B Input:
Speaker A: A new cat arrived at the shelter. He is very cute, but not cuter than puppies! ###Speaker B: Why do you like puppies so much?  What's so different about kittens and puppies? It is nice to see puppies wagging their tail and just following you!  Changing topics, do you have any recipes with asparagus?  You know, it's such a popular vegetable, but I just don't know how to prepare it. ###Speaker A: I don't have recipes but I know how to make a good grilled asparagus. Are you looking to bolster your chef book? ###Speaker B: I sure am!  Grilled asparagus does sound good.  Do you pair the grilled asparagus with your fajitas?  What do you prefer, chicken or beef fajitas? ###Speaker A: I prefer chicken to beef. I pair it with beef fajitas andI think it's great to have with a glass of merlot. Do you like wine? ###Speaker B: You're making me hungry!  Yes, I do love wine.  As a matter of fact, I used to live in the Bordeaux region in France, so my favorite wine is Bordeaux wine.  But I also love champagne and cognac. ###Speaker A: Haha, I know right? I lived in the Champagne region for a bit! Always wanted to go to Bordeaux. How was it there? ###
``` 
